Threat Description: Attackers can manipulate data in the JBoss 1.2 application due to improper access controls or vulnerabilities in the application using the database.
Countermeasure: Implement proper access controls and encryption for sensitive data, and regularly update the JBoss 1.2 software with the latest security patches.
NIST Reference: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 4 - Appendix F: Data Management
ASVS Reference: OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) - Data Validation and Encryption
OWASP Reference: OWASP Cheat Sheet - Data Validation and Encryption
SANS Reference: SANS Institute - Securing Web Applications: A Beginner's Guide to Web Application Security
CIS Reference: Center for Internet Security (CIS) - CIS Critical Security Controls for Effective Cyber Defense
MITRE Tactics Description: Data Tampering: Modifying or manipulating data to compromise the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of the data.
MITRE Techniques Description: Data Encryption: Using encryption to protect data from unauthorized access or tampering.

Threat Description: Attackers can inject malicious commands into the JBoss 1.2 application's SQL queries, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data manipulation.
Countermeasure: Implement proper input validation and sanitization mechanisms to prevent command injection attacks.

Threat Description: Attackers can inject malicious SQL code into the JBoss 1.2 application's database queries, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data manipulation.
Countermeasure: Implement proper input validation and sanitization mechanisms to prevent SQL injection attacks.

Countermeasure: Implement proper input validation and sanitization mechanisms to prevent XSS attacks.

Threat Description: Attackers can trick JBoss 1.2 application users into performing unintended actions, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data manipulation.
Countermeasure: Implement proper input validation and sanitization mechanisms to prevent CSRF attacks.
